welcome.title: Boreal
welcome.subtitle: Cold private storage, vivid memories.
welcome.createVault.title: Create New Vault
welcome.createVault.description: Set up a new vault with your AWS account. Takes about 2 minutes.
welcome.importVault.title: I Have a Vault
welcome.importVault.description: Import an existing vault file from another device.
welcome.footer: Your photos are encrypted on your device. AWS only sees encrypted blobs.

configure.title: Configure Your Vault
configure.description: Choose where to store your photos and how you want to access them.

region.label: Region
region.hint: Choose the region closest to you for faster uploads.

deepArchive.name: Deep Archive
deepArchive.description: Best for photos you rarely access. Originals take 12-48 hours to retrieve.

instantRetrieval.name: Instant Retrieval
instantRetrieval.description: Best for photos you access frequently. Originals are always available.

connectAws.title: Connect Your AWS Account
connectAws.description: We'll open AWS CloudFormation to set up your storage. It only takes a minute.

steps.1: Click the button below to open AWS in your browser
steps.2: Log in to your AWS account (or create one)
steps.3: Review the stack and click "Create Stack"
steps.4: Wait about 30 seconds for setup to complete
steps.5: Go to the "Outputs" tab and copy the Vault Code

vaultCode.label: Vault Code
vaultCode.placeholder: Paste the Vault Code from AWS Outputs here...

import.title: Import Your Vault
import.description: Select your vault file or paste the vault code from another device.
import.error: Invalid vault file format. Missing required fields.
